title: Check for Updates button broken after latest cactbot update

chats.content: The latest cactbot update included the following commit which switched to using OverlayPlugin's ILogger interface rather than its own.quisquous/cactbot@d07965aNormally I'd PR a fix for this issue, but to be honest I have no idea what's going on in the corresponding button handler.OverlayPlugin/OverlayPlugin.Core/Controls/GeneralConfigTab.csLines 129 to 168in1a4232e private void btnCactbotUpdate_Click(object sender, EventArgs e){try{var asm = Assembly.Load("CactbotEventSource");var checkerType = asm.GetType("Cactbot.VersionChecker");var loggerType = asm.GetType("Cactbot.ILogger");var configType = asm.GetType("Cactbot.CactbotEventSourceConfig"); var esList = container.Resolve<Registry>().EventSources;IEventSource cactbotEs = null; foreach (var es in esList){if (es.Name == "Cactbot Config" || es.Name == "Cactbot"){cactbotEs = es;break;}} if (cactbotEs == null){MessageBox.Show("Cactbot is loaded but it never registered with OverlayPlugin!", "Error");return;} var cactbotConfig = cactbotEs.GetType().GetProperty("Config").GetValue(cactbotEs);configType.GetField("LastUpdateCheck").SetValue(cactbotConfig, DateTime.MinValue); var checker = checkerType.GetConstructor(new Type[] { loggerType }).Invoke(new object[] { cactbotEs });checkerType.GetMethod("DoUpdateCheck", new Type[] {configType}).Invoke(checker, new object[] { cactbotConfig });} catch(FileNotFoundException){MessageBox.Show("Could not find Cactbot!", "Error");} catch(Exception ex){MessageBox.Show("Failed: " + ex.ToString(), "Error");}} cc @ngld @quisquousThe text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

title: PartyChangedEvent not called correctly in all cases

chats.content: Requeuing in an instance or having somebody disconnect may cause the current party (via PartyChangedEvent) to be incorrect.I suspect but am not 100% sure that the FFXIV plugin is not calling the PartyChangeDelegate that's been registered in all the cases it should, but I have not tracked this down.It could also be that it is sent, but it is incorrect?See: https://discordapp.com/channels/551474815727304704/594899820976668673/687441928337621009The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

Ah, with some debugging, I figured it out. IDataRepository.GetCombatantList does not have all the combatants when PartyListChangedDelegate is called.In the case of a reconnect, the PartyListChangedDelegate has all the right values but the combatant is missing entirely (not just the wrong type).I'm not sure what the solution is yet, but that's the problem. All reactions

title: about CombatantMemoryChangeType

chats.content: When I hubt hunt-mobs with ACT on, LineCombatant causes every memory change to be written to the logs, which makes the logs very large, with many invalid logs.I don't think this is a very good planThe text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

What would your suggestion be then?I assume the issue during hunt trains is the large amount of players. We could potentially look at limiting player combatant lines to follow the parse filter settings, e.g. None/Self/Party/Alliance? All reactions
Maybe a checkbox option to disable the lines in non-instanced content? All reactions

We could potentially look at limiting player combatant lines to follow the parse filter settings, e.g. None/Self/Party/Alliance?We'd need to really think about this one. My understanding of the parse filter is that it only affects who gets DPS calculations, and does not affect the log file in any meaningful way. This option would change that, and it would become yet another thing to check for tech support.If this option were chosen, I think that "Self" would need to be treated the same as "Party".Maybe a checkbox option to disable the lines in non-instanced content?I don't believe the XIV plugin directly exposes instanced vs non instanced content, so it might require pulling that data in through whatever means. All reactions

@tssailzz8 Can you upload a log somewhere so we can have some numbers on how much "very large" is for this use case compared to the use cases we looked at previously.I assume the issue during hunt trains is the large amount of players. We could potentially look at limiting player combatant lines to follow the parse filter settings, e.g. None/Self/Party/Alliance?Personally, I'd prefer the fewest options (ideally zero) for anything used for triggers.It's already confusing enough to handle people who have turned chat log stuff off or have different languages, and we don't need extra dimensions of tech support.In that vein, I could imagine an allow list "only include these lines in instanced content" or "don't include these lines in the overworld" deny list approach.The type of zone can be looked up from zone id fairly easily. All reactions
I'd also like to point out that if a log is somehow becoming invalidated due to size (I assume this is about fflogs), that sounds like a problem of its own. All reactions

Actually, I don't know the LineCombatant can trigger what.if you want to konw the weapon change at first time ，i think we can use network like https://github.com/tssailzz8/cacbotSelf/blob/27e0c8744f24205c0a0b7b297fc3fda359478942/CactbotSelf/CactbotSelf/MainClass.cs#L612 All reactions

Combatant lines aren't just for weapon ID, they also allow for much more accurate combatant data such as positioning when all you have to work with is a log file (Cactbot raid emulator, Triggevent import, etc). Otherwise, you only know the position of a combatant when a relevant log line is written, and sometimes the data is stale (e.g. if an actor moves and immediately begins the cast, ACT might process the cast packet before the game processes the ActorMove packet). All reactions
I have a dalamud plugin that can play the logs through replay and then test the triggers through iinact to get more accurate results.It is more realistic All reactions

I also have my own format for doing replays, but the idea is to have a single format that works everywhere and is recorded by default. Being able to replay a special format doesn't do any good if, for example, and end-user has a problem with a trigger that depends on combatant data, since I won't be able to recreate the state. All reactions
So I think this type of log is only needed by developers and not users All reactions

So I think this type of log is only needed by developers and not usersBut sometimes the developer needs the user's log in order to troubleshoot issues with a trigger. If the trigger is dependent on live combatants data such as positioning, then those lines are necessary in order to accurately reproduce the problem. All reactions
so i think we can add a checkbox tu open it or close it All reactions

I'm fine with a checkbox as long as it's opt-out.Come to think of it, after reading your code, if we could hook ActorSetPos, that would probably cover many of the important scenarios without the spamminess of also hooking ActorMove. All reactions

Handling network packets for ActorSetPos or ActorMove don't solve the problem since it's still possible that the ACT packet handling resolves before the game does and we end up with this order:OP processes ActorSetPos with new positionFFXIV_ACT_Plugin processes ActorCast, triggers 20 line, has stale position dataGame processes ActorSetPosGame processes ActorCast All reactions

I still feel like everybody (including me) is talking about solutions, but the details of the problem are still not clear to me.can you upload the log in question so we can see how much bigger it is with these lineswhat does "many invalid logs" mean? All reactions

Pending other thoughts and feedback here, I have a local branch ready to open a PR with the following changes:Reduce the polling rate of memory reads to improve performance on Linux, see conversation starting here: https://discord.com/channels/551474815727304704/611368387678830616/1112360885969764352in combat still polls every 20msout of combat polls every 1000msHave LineCombatant subscribe to NetworkParser.OnOnlineStatusChanged (and this event really needs a rework), watch for status ID 43 (corresponding to "In Duty", also 25 = "Waiting For Duty Finder" for future reference)Early out in CheckCombatants, as such:private void CheckCombatants(DateTime now, params uint[] filter){// Do not check if we're not in combat and we're not in a dutyif (!inCombat && !inDuty)return;I agree with quisquous that we need to know what "many invalid logs" means before making any further changes, though. 👍3 marzent, xpdota, and xiashtra reacted with thumbs up emoji All reactions👍3 reactions

I believe there is also some data that could be trimmed off these lines. For example, cast data just causes every 20-line to also generate a 261-line with the same data but even longer, and potentially delayed anyway due to the polling rate. All reactions

I believe there is also some data that could be trimmed off these lines. For example, cast data just causes every 20-line to also generate a 261-line with the same data but even longer, and potentially delayed anyway due to the polling rate.Sorry, I disagree here.Part of the reason these lines exist is that 0x14/0x15/0x16 lines have incorrect data much of the time.I asked for it to be added originally, but if I had known how stale it would be (and that there'd be no re-checking memory before printing the line) I would have just left it off.It's also why I don't think it makes any sense to add target information to ffxiv plugin lines if it will have the same issue. All reactions

Sorry, I disagree here. Part of the reason these lines exist is that 0x14/0x15/0x16 lines have incorrect data much of the time. I asked for it to be added originally, but if I had known how stale it would be (and that there'd be no re-checking memory before printing the line) I would have just left it off. It's also why I don't think it makes any sense to add target information to ffxiv plugin lines if it will have the same issue.If we're talking about the same thing, the stale/incorrect data is the positions/headings, which would still be written out in 261-lines even if it didn't have any cast-specific fields. The pieces that are specific to 20-lines, like the cast ID and cast target, are always correct* from what I've seen, because they come from the packet rather than memory. Those are the only fields I'm referring to here.*there's a few with "follow-through" time, but that's a different story. 👍1 quisquous reacted with thumbs up emoji All reactions👍1 reaction

title: Feature Request: WebSocket configuration API

chats.content: A configuration API that exposes the WebSocket information and ability to start/stop it would be useful in order to allow other plugins to automatically configure themselves correctly, or to start the WS if needed.ngld said they'd do it, but sadly that was two days after the last commit, so I don't know if it's in a partially-finished state somewhere or what.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

The hardest part is designing the API in a way that doesn't break after plugin updates. The easiest solution would be to add a new struct with the configuration parameters to the OverlayPlugin assembly and then a few methods to the OverlayPlugin.PluginLoader class that update the WS config, start, stop the server or generate the URL. The code for those methods would just be Container.Resolve<WSServer>().Start();, return Container.Resolve<WSServer>().GetModernUrl(url);, etc.Shouldn't take too long to write. I'll submit a PR once I get around to it (sorry for the bad timing, BTW). All reactions

I'm still not entirely sure why this started to happen, but hopefully this can help anyone else who winds up encountering this particular issue.Thanks! All reactions

I don't think I can really fix this. ACT itself isn't DPI aware and if I started to mess with that, it's very likely I'd break something else. The only solution I can see right now would be launching a second process that is DPI aware and renders the overlay instead of ACT itself.That's going to be a lot of work (since all of the log events, etc.) would have to be passed between the two processes. I probably won't work on something like this any time soon. All reactions

title: Upstream remaining cactbot C# code where needed

chats.content: It would be nice to have a definitive list of remaining cactbot ACT plugin code that would need ported or adjusted to eliminate the C# side of the cactbot plugin.Doing some quick checks shows (please add additional details if they're missing here):JSEvents.csForceReloadEvent: Used when user config changes, see thoughts on user config below.GameExistsEvent: This seems to only be used by cactbot's test overlay, as far as I can see? If it's actually needed still, OP has detection for this and an event can be added.GameActiveChangedEvent: Same as GameExistsEvent.LogEvent: This should be able to be re replaced with OP's LogLine event?ImportLogEvent: Seems to be unused? I think this used to be used by raidemulator before the rewrite?InCombatChangedEvent: Should be able to be changed to existing OP InCombat event, part of EnmityEventSource?ZoneChangedEvent: Seems to be unused?PlayerDiedEvent: Seems to be unused?CEEvent: New log line replacing this.FateEvent: New log line replacing this.PlayerChangedEvent: Needs ported?EntityChangedEvent: Seems to be unused?SendSaveData: Seems to be unused?DataFilesRead: Seems to be unused?CactbotEventSource.csMost events covered above as part of JSEvents.csFor CreateConfigControl, I think it makes sense to port a more generalized version of this to OP, see thoughts on user config below.Everything else C#-side is to support the above two files.Regarding user config, I think it makes sense to create a new event, which accepts something like the following://request:{"type": "RegisterConfigPanel","Name": "Cactbot Config","URL": "file:///...",}//response:{"result": "success", // or "failure""message": "Panel registered", // or "panel already registered", or other error messages?}The cactbot config.html page can then load/save data with the associated existing events, and if a reload of raidboss/etc is required, that can be emitted via the existing BroadcastMessage event.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

At a high level, I think I'd want to stage this deprecation by announcing removals to people (discord? cactbot release notes), switching cactbot over to any new events and handlers, then doing a cactbot release where all the now-unused events/handlers are removed, giving people a chance to yell if anybody was using it, and then considering it done after that.I don't suspect anybody's really using any of these, but honestly you never know sometimes.Events that are not event sent right now can obviously be removed immediately on the cactbot end.Goodness there seems to be a lot.Another option also is that ngld was thinking about doing a compatibility layer in common.js.ngld — 06/28/2020The way Cactbot and OverlayPlugin dispatch events is very for example.I think I can add a compatibility layer in common.min.js.quisquous — 06/28/2020So like:(1) add renamed events to OverlayPlugin(2) release OverlayPlugin(3) get downstream cactbot users to switch(4) get cactbot to switch(5) remove cactbot events(6) release cactbotsort of thing?ngld — 06/28/2020Implement event aliases in common.min.jsRelease OverlayPlugin with the new event names and add a flag that common.min.js can use to detect whether it will receive the old or new eventsUpdate Cactbot (and any other overlays) to use the new namesEventually remove the event rewriting again (not necessary though)Not sure what makes sense here, just bringing back old conversations for context.EventsGameExistsEvent comes from quisquous/cactbot@b426c5d and I think the OverlayPlugin "hide overlays when game not active" superseded it immediately.I'd be fine removing it.LogEvent, InCombatChangedEvent, ZoneChangedEvent were all cactbot-specific events that switched over to using the OverlayPlugin version.ImportLogEvent was used by the original raidemulator, yeah.I don't think we need it anymore.PlayerDiedEvent was never used.PlayerChangedEvent does need porting.EntityChangedEvent was briefly used by OnTargetChanged / OnFocusChanged and I removed those but forgot to remove the base class.SendSaveData got replaced by cactbotSaveData and cactbotLoadData handlers and so doesn't exist anymore.DataFilesRead was the way to get all the files in a manifest before we had an explicit manifest.It can get removed.HandlersYou're missing all the RegisterEventHandler calls in CactbotEventSource as well.I don't think these are a big deal, but it might make sense to drop the cactbot name on them and then switch cactbot over to using the OverlayPlugin version.cactbotLoadUser is the big one.This is the one that ngld was most afraid of because it reads files off of a user's disk and then executes them.The user does need to specify a directory in the config, but this is minimal security for somebody changing that setting and then reading files remotely over a websocket connection.I'm not sure what we can do to make this better, to be honest.We could only read js/css files (and text files if underneath raidboss subdir), but that's kind of minimal protection.We could force the user directory to be a single place (like %APPDATA% somewhere with other ACT stuff) or at least rooted in a single place.I'm not sure what the right answer here is, but this is probably the biggest question.cactbotReloadOverlays uses ForceReloadEvent, so maybe can be removed with the other thoughts about reloading.cactbotRequestPlayerUpdate is used by oopsyraidsy (I can't remember why but git blame might tell you) to force a player update event to occur.cactbotRequestState is used in a few places for all of the tracked state (and not just the player).Maybe these should be combined and we only need one?cactbotSay I think is reasonable to have.I don't know that there's any other way to use tts from an overlay.cactbotChooseDirectory is there for the config to add a directory picker that isn't supported by CEF.cactbotLoadData / cactbotSaveData are both things that need to exist as well to write and read to the OverlayPlugin config.ConfigRe: user config.One thing I had talked with ngld before (but never convinced them) was that I wonder if it makes sense for OverlayPlugin to provide a way to add a config tab per overlay.It sounds like you're suggesting that all overlays generate the cactbot config, but I was wondering a little if it made sense to put the config on the overlay page itself, e.g. if you have a raidboss overlay then the raidboss tab would have an extra section down below all the .net settings that has the html config control for raidboss.Maybe cactbot would still need a top-level config, but this would also let other overlays that don't have a plugin backing add config pages.I'd probably do this for target bars, etc.Agreed that the reload could be removed.Mostly just brainstorming here. All reactions
cactbotSay I think is reasonable to have. I don't know that there's any other way to use tts from an overlay.Isn't it just the 'say' handler? Or is there something else to it? All reactions

At a high level, I think I'd want to stage this deprecation by announcing removals to people (discord? cactbot release notes), switching cactbot over to any new events and handlers, then doing a cactbot release where all the now-unused events/handlers are removed, giving people a chance to yell if anybody was using it, and then considering it done after that. I don't suspect anybody's really using any of these, but honestly you never know sometimes.I think this makes sense. IIRC, ZeffUI was using something from cactbot? I'm not sure if that's still the case, but it's registered by cactbot (CactbotEventSource.cs, line 696 in my local copy of the repo).Events that are not event sent right now can obviously be removed immediately on the cactbot end. Goodness there seems to be a lot.Yeah, there were more than I was expecting when I first looked.Another option also is that ngld was thinking about doing a compatibility layer in common.js.I don't think a compatibility layer makes sense in common.js in general, any code like that would be pretty ugly. Every request to OP and every request received from OP would have to be investigated and translated if needed.LogEvent, InCombatChangedEvent, ZoneChangedEvent were all cactbot-specific events that switched over to using the OverlayPlugin version.LogEvent in cactbot's JSEvents.cs corresponds to onLogEvent in cactbot's CactbotEventSource.cs, which is still used by popup-text.ts, raidboss.ts, and test.ts, as far as I can see?cactbotSay I think is reasonable to have. I don't know that there's any other way to use tts from an overlay.As xpdota said, there's a say handler in base OP's MiniParseEventSource.cs which does basically the same thing but with more input checking.cactbotChooseDirectory/cactbotLoadData/cactbotSaveDataSee further explanations on config below.cactbotLoadUserI think that there's a fairly simple solution to this. Given that there's already a forced location for RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.config.json, it makes sense to me to enforce a subdirectory structure per overlay handler call.Overlay requests:{"type": "LoadFiles","overlayType": "cactbot",}OP first strips all characters from overlayType which exist in Path.GetInvalidFileNameChars()OP builds directory path via Path.Combine(ActGlobals.oFormActMain.AppDataFolder.FullName, "Config", "OverlayPluginUserFiles", cleanOverlayType)OP sends back file/contents map as responseI believe that this will address any potential security issues, as the root directory is hardcoded and any potential traversal issues are handled by stripping invalid file name characters.It may also make sense to allow overlays to override this directory during registration, e.g.:Registry.RegisterOverlayPreset(new OverlayPreset{Name = "Cactbot Raidboss (Combined Alerts & Timeline)",Url = Path.Combine("https://quisquous.github.io/cactbot", "ui", "raidboss", "raidboss.html"),Size = new int[] { 1100, 300 },Locked = false,LoadFilesOverlayType = "cactbot",LoadFilesDirectory = Path.Combine(ActGlobals.oFormActMain.AppDataFolder.FullName, "cactbot", "user"),});This should be similarly secure.There may be a need for one or both of the following as well:a. OpenFilesDirectory - Opens the files directory for the given overlayType.b. Have the LoadFiles return the determined path - Could leak Windows username though?Regarding config:I think that either setup should be fine, but there's a question of "what happens when someone is using three cactbot overlays, as far as config is concerned?". Should it for instance share the Panel .NET object across the tabs? Should clicking over to that tab force a refresh of the config page itself in case configs have been changed elsewhere?Additionally, does it make sense to for instance move the cactbot config to native controls instead of having it rendered as html? e.g. should the original suggestion of a RegisterConfigPanel handler instead accept a tree of controls to display/config options? All reactions

I think this makes sense. IIRC, ZeffUI was using something from cactbot? I'm not sure if that's still the case, but it's registered by cactbot (CactbotEventSource.cs, line 696 in my local copy of the repo).ZeffUI is using the player changed event, I think?Another option also is that ngld was thinking about doing a compatibility layer in common.js.I don't think a compatibility layer makes sense in common.js in general, any code like that would be pretty ugly. Every request to OP and every request received from OP would have to be investigated and translated if needed.👍 I was just throwing it out as an alternative to consdier.LogEvent, InCombatChangedEvent, ZoneChangedEvent were all cactbot-specific events that switched over to using the OverlayPlugin version.LogEvent in cactbot's JSEvents.cs corresponds to onLogEvent in cactbot's CactbotEventSource.cs, which is still used by popup-text.ts, raidboss.ts, and test.ts, as far as I can see?Ok, so maybe these need to be transitioned first as well.cactbotSay I think is reasonable to have. I don't know that there's any other way to use tts from an overlay.As xpdota said, there's a say handler in base OP's MiniParseEventSource.cs which does basically the same thing but with more input checking.👍cactbotChooseDirectory/cactbotLoadData/cactbotSaveDataSee further explanations on config below.Maybe I am misunderstanding what you are saying, I think you are confusing these.cactbotChooseDirectory / cactbotLoadUser are related to cactbot user files.It's picking a directory and then loading all the files underneath that directory and sending them to the overlay to eval (for js), append to the page (for css), or load as timelines (txt).cactbotLoadData and cactbotSaveData are loading/saving JSON structures into the OverlayPlugin config json file.This is used for cactbot config info as well as pull counters (maybe other stuff?).This doesn't touch anything on disk in an insecure way, as it all goes into the OverlayPlugin config file only.cactbotLoadUserI think that there's a fairly simple solution to this. Given that there's already a forced location for RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.config.json, it makes sense to me to enforce a subdirectory structure per overlay handler call.Mmmm, per-overlay directories doesn't entirely work with the existing cactbot structure, in that it loads everything out of one user directory.Subdirectory support was added later and I suspect that most people are not using it.It'd force many users to rename their user/raidboss.js files, or put things into subdirectories for them to continue working.Not saying it's impossible to add this restriction, but it would cause a good deal of pain, I think.I think loading a single directory rooted in AppData is plausible, but many users dislike this for whatever reason (see various issues and discord complaints where people want to put stuff somewhere else).A compromise is to load from somewhere that is rooted in the same directory that the DLL is in.e.g. if the DLL is in C:\somedir\OverlayPlugin.dll then C:\somedir\someotherdir\user\ is valid.It could be custom-picked or we could just hardcode it relative to the plugin.In any case, this would also cause user pain, but we could probably log a warning and also add a "please move your A directory to B directory instead" warning at the top of the cactbot config page.There may be a need for one or both of the following as well:a. OpenFilesDirectory - Opens the files directory for the given overlayType. b. Have the LoadFiles return the determined path - Could leak Windows username though?I'm not sure how this is different than the above? Is this a version with less processing on the C# side?Regarding config:I think that either setup should be fine, but there's a question of "what happens when someone is using three cactbot overlays, as far as config is concerned?". Should it for instance share the Panel .NET object across the tabs? Should clicking over to that tab force a refresh of the config page itself in case configs have been changed elsewhere?I guess there's two different config ideas here.There's "top level config shared among multiple overlays" and also "config for an individual overlay".I could imagine various options:support both ideas: shared config gets its own tab (like cactbot config), multiple overlays that register the same shared config just merge together/get de-duped, and individual config panels show up on the overlay panel itself (cons: extra work, cactbot probably the only one with this "problem")only top level config: any overlay that registers a shared config gets its own panel like "cactbot config" now, multiple registrations of the same thing get de-duped, (cons: possibly lots of tabs??)only individual configs: any overlay that registers a config has it show up on its own overlay tab (cons: weird to have the same shared cactbot config show up on every overlay panel, and have to reload other overlays when this changes)EDIT: other options include creating a new tab for overlay configs, rather than inserting them into the same place as overlays themselves.Additionally, does it make sense to for instance move the cactbot config to native controls instead of having it rendered as html? e.g. should the original suggestion of a RegisterConfigPanel handler instead accept a tree of controls to display/config options?I don't know.I find native controls to be cumbersome to implement, but maybe I'm just less familiar.There's a lot of things that cactbot needs to do (e.g. trigger names, trigger info, translations, timeline loading) to set up the config page that it would have to pass to C# to have that do.I think it'd be easier for cactbot (and other overlays) to set up html controls since they're already in html/js land, rather than try to dynamically generate native controls.If you're talking about statically generating controls, then I think that's opposed to the idea of getting rid of plugin code (and I'm not sure it'd make sense to have OverlayPlugin include cactbot native controls). All reactions

title: DPS update interval seconds question.

chats.content: Would it be possible to change DPS update interval seconds to be a float instead of an int? I'd like to set the rate that the parse overlay updates to be equal to my frame rate instead of being limited to once per second for presentation purposes as my overlay skin actually has "moving parts" similar to a bar graph..I believe this was possible in the old overlay plugin but don't quote me on that.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

I think you're mixing up two settings. There's a DPS update interval that dictates how much time passes between DPS updates. Each update sends the current DPS from ACT's Main tab to the overlays. IMO there's no point in updating those more than once per second.Each overlay also has a framerate limit (on the Advanced tab). I think you'd want to change that.The framerate limit defaults to 30 and can be increased to 60 if you want to. 60 is the max limit since Chrome can't render any more than that. Finally, keep in mind that overlay rendering happens on the CPU which means that increasing the framerate limit will also increase ACT's CPU usage. All reactions

title: Should this repo (or org) host ACT/FFXIV docs

chats.content: Techno (who ignored the invite to this repo and so I can't @ them) asked me about various docs that are floating around.This is mostly stuff pinned in ACT discords that are owned by ngld or other people (who also aren't around).I think it'd make sense to consolidate this stuff ... somewhere? where there are multiple owners.I'm asking here mostly because there's not a lot of other shared space to have this conversation, and some of the options include this repo and org.These docs include:https://gist.github.com/ngld/e2217563bbbe1750c0917217f136687dhttps://github.com/FFXIV-ACT/setup-guide#readmePossible options include:Add these docs to this repoCreate a new repo (e.g. OverlayPlugin/guides or OverlayPlugin/docs or OverlayPlugin/ACT_FFXIV) and add docs to that repoCreate a new org and repo (e.g. ACT_FFXIV)These docs are sort of out of place here (given that they're kind of aimed at "general FFXIV plugin setup), but simultaneously they already include a lot of stuff about overlays and OverlayPlugin, and so I think they could be a good fit too.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions
3 makes the most sense to me if there was a plan to ever host the plugin inside of that repo; however, I think OverlayPlugin/docs is also fine All reactions

My thoughts are that documentation should live as close to the project that it is relevant to as possible. OP docs should be in OP, general XIV/ACT guides in either the ACT_FFXIV repo/org, and so on.My main concern is not having another issue like the log guide, where it's intertwined with one project, but is used as the general guide because it's effectively just documenting the ACT plugin. So I'd rather err on the side of "keep the docs in the repo of the thing they're documenting". All reactions

I think that from my perspective, documentation should live based on the writers/maintainers rather than on the subject. That's why it previously made sense to keep e.g. cactbot's LogGuide.md in cactbot, because the primary maintainers/writers of the documentation were also primarily contributing to that repo. (I think that line has blurred a bit and maybe that's a conversation to have later on after seeing how this resolves and how future additional log lines and such pan out, but it's definitely not a conversation to have now.)However, counteracting that is that I believe that documentation shouldn't exist alongside code that it's not documenting.As such, I'm fine with either options 2 or 3.My concern with 2 is that it may pose an issue inviting someone to the org when all they'll be doing is editing guides.My concern with 3 is that it's likely that any org for documentation will also include all the members of this org, and I'm not sure if you can set up github permissions to say "this org includes everyone from that org". As such, keeping members/permissions synced between the two may be a bit sketchy/annoying. All reactions

My concern with 2 is that it may pose an issue inviting someone to the org when all they'll be doing is editing guides.I think that should be fine.You can set up a separate "docs" team for a hypothetical OverlayPlugin/docs repo that has separate permissions.Being invited to the org doesn't necessarily give any permissions until they were assigned this new team.As such, keeping members/permissions synced between the two may be a bit sketchy/annoying.Yeah, this is my feeling as well.Also, I think that having everything under a single organization makes the "vacation factor" a little bit less of a risk too since there's more likely to be somebody who can sort out privileges, than some random one-off repo somewhere else.The community is already fractured enough and hard to find things that having more places for people to look will only make things harder.EDIT: I guess for me reading all of this is that I'm leaning (2) in my original list. All reactions
I'll go ahead and do (2) and make a OverlayPlugin/docs repo. All reactions
https://github.com/OverlayPlugin/docs All reactions

title: Opcodes in config don't update when resources/opcodes.jsonc is updated

chats.content: Let's say that we are in a situation where we accidently merge the wrong opcode on a game update, and at the same time we never did an OP release since it's unnecessary for opcode updates.User opens ACT. OverlayPlugin fetches the latest opcodes since the config doesn't have any for the latest game ver.Incorrect opcode is saved to the user's configWe realize the incorrect opcode issue and fix it, then do a new OP release (or don't, doesn't matter)resources/opcodes.jsonc might have the correct opcode, but user config still has the incorrect one. Since the game ver in the config is the latest one, OP will not try to re-fetch opcodes or check resources/opcodes.jsonc.One solution could be to always check the local resources/opcodes.jsonc first, and if there's no opcode for the latest game ver, then check the user config. If there's no opcode for the user config, fetch it from github & save it to the user config. This way if we do make a mistake with the opcodes, a new OP release will resolve the issue. Alternatively, you could just always try to fetch it from github, but I don't like the idea of always making an external request due to load time.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

OverlayPlugin/OverlayPlugin.Core/Integration/OverlayPluginLogLines.csLines 196 to 213in8e37743 IOpcodeConfigEntry opcode = null;opcode = GetOpcode(name, opcodesConfig, version, "config");if (opcode == null){opcode = GetOpcode(name, opcodesFile, version, "file"); // Try once to get this remotely, but only if this opcode or version is missing.// TODO: we could consider getting this once always too, but for now// if we ever have an incorrect (but present) opcode, another release is required.if (opcode == null && !haveAttemptedOpcodeDownload){haveAttemptedOpcodeDownload = true;SaveRemoteOpcodesToConfig();return GetOpcode(name, opcodesConfig, version, "config");}} return opcode; There is a comment here implying that a release will work, but from testing + reading the code, it'll only check the resources file if the opcode doesn't exist in the config. All reactions

Hmm.I thought I tested this but maybe something is incorrect.It could be probably be more clear in the code, regardless.My understanding is that the constructor loads the config opcodes and the file opcodes separately.If the config opcodes are from a previous OP release, it clears them in the config and does not use them.Then when an opcode is missing, it first tries to get them from the config (which is guaranteed to be newer than the OP release, based on clearing earlier) and if that's missing it falls back to the file, and if that's missing it tries to download newer ones.The intention is as you state, that you should be able to release OP to fix any bad opcodes, and any OP release takes precedence over anything in the config downloaded before that. All reactions

Ah, I didn't realize the existence of CachedOpcodeOverlayPluginVersion when doing testing, so that is probably why I experienced this.I did another test, this time downgrading the cache'd OP version, and the correct opcode was used. Sorry about that! All reactions

No worries at all! It's a good question, and the code is clearly not obvious what's going on.If you see some way to make it more clear (maybe the version check needs to be in the constructor with a comment?), feel free to let me know so it's less confusing. All reactions

title: Modify the accuracy of the effective distance

title: A port for plugin's common.js API

chats.content: Hello, I recently ported the API provided by common.js to an ES6+ class module and published it to npm registry, so it can be imported from a modern workflow with package bundler easier, with more convenient updating and maintainability. I also added full doc comment to it for future development.I made some modification to make it possible adding or removing listeners whenever you want without calling startOverlayEvents(). I've tested this well on my own private React.js overlay but I don't know whether I should send messages to the plugin like this.Ported API and modified functions:https://github.com/amzrk2/ffxiv-overlay-api/blob/master/src/api.js#L96-L125https://github.com/amzrk2/ffxiv-overlay-api/blob/master/src/main.js#L34-L43npm registry:https://www.npmjs.com/package/ffxiv-overlay-apiFinally, could I ask if you would like to be added as a collaborator to this repository? That would be great help for future development.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

Hm... this is kind of goes against what I intended when I implemented common.js. The dev docs explicitly mention that you're not supposed to bundle common.min.js and instead load the one I host.Most importantly I consider stuff like window.__OverlayCallback an implementation detail that could change in the next OverlayPlugin release.The idea was that if I had to change that API, I could just add a check to common.min.js and use the old API if the script is loaded in an old OverlayPlugin version and the new API in the opposite case.That's still possible if people bundle common.js with their overlay but that would also means that each overlay would have to update before I could release the next OverlayPlugin version.Finally, I added startOverlayEvents() intentionally to avoid common issues with cached events.A few events are triggered immediately after you register a listener for them with OverlayPlugin. This includes events like ChangeZone and ChangePrimaryPlayer. The idea behind this is that when your overlay appears, the player might already exist and might already be in a zone. You probably don't want to wait until the player (or the zone) changes so instead OverlayPlugin immediately triggers the event with the current value. However, this means that only the first listener that is registered will receive this data which can be confusing if it isn't explained anywhere.If you register all event listeners before you call startOverlayEvents(), this is never a problem since all listeners are registered before a single event is processed.In practice, I've never had a reason to register more listeners once the page has been loaded. Just calling startOverlayEvents() in my load event listern worked well enough and you don't have to pass any events since it can detect the necessary events through the listener registration.TL;DR: This is a nice effort but I'm not entirely sure how useful it's going to be since bundling the file might cause your overlay to break in future OverlayPlugin versions.Sorry for the long answer. I think I tried to explain too hard why things are the way they are. ^^" All reactions

Thank you for your long answer 😁I've been working on our own overlay with a couple of my raid group members recently, so this bundle is intended to make our own development easier. New features like simplifying data and detecting job types have also been added. Anyways, this is just a personal project and I'll try to make it work properly in the future. Your explanation of the event listeners and the immediately triggered event is very clear; it will help us in future work. All reactions

I went for some low-hanging fruit in 73ae931:can ngrok-x64.exe be started hidden? There's already a start and stop button in the OverlayPlugin UI for thisI think I made the ngrok window visible during testing and forgot to turn that option off once I was done.closing the ngrok-x64.exe command window doesn't update the UI to say it is stoppedThis should work now but probably needs some polish (it just sets the tunnel status to Failed right now).when restarting shared overlays (or switching tabs from shared to stream/local), the URL generator url doesn't update to reflect the new idRestarting shared overlays now updates the generated URLs. Switching tabs doesn't, at least not yet.closing ACT should kill any open ngrok process so it doesn't have to be closed manually before starting it againThis should work now."It works!" page should include ngrok query strings instead of local query strings if loaded over ngrokThis is going to be difficult. Right now I generate the URLs on the server because I don't want to implement the URL generator twice (once in JS and once in C#). However, the server doesn't know if you're opening the page through ngrok or not since ngrok sends the same Host: header that a local browser would send for http://127.0.0.1:10501. I can change this but that requires a rewrite of the WebSocket implementation first. I want to get rid of WebSocket-Sharp (the current implementation) due to some annoying issues but it's fairly low priority for now.Regarding the file:/// URLs: At least for the builtin overlays (target bars, enmity, etc.), OverlayPlugin already generates working file:/// URLs. If you're seeing %% characters, then the replacement fails somewhere (the preset URL uses %%/ as the placeholder for the local file path).The URLs are listed because they still work in OBS which is a common enough use for them as far as I'm aware.I can probably extend the URL generator to generate different URLs for overlays vs. WebSocket URLs.The text typo has been fixed.I should add some error messages if one of the two ports is blocked. Will look more into this tomorrow. All reactions

title: Improve opcode updating

chats.content: Currently:opcodes use a cache config, if it existsif OverlayPlugin has been updated, clear the cached configif cached config doesn't exist, load from the fileif opcode is ever missing (game version or specific opcode), download cached configThis can cause some issues where you're developing locally, you update the file partially, e.g. #121.Then you run, and the other opcodes are missing, so it grabs the cached config which doesn't have the right version, and the cached config is then stored and takes precedence forever until OverlayPlugin updates.Probably we need to load the file and the cached config, and try to fall back to the file if the cached config is missing stuff? There's a TODO for this.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

OverlayPlugin already catches and logs the exception. There's not much more I can do.The main issue is that the FFXIV plugin doesn't handle multi threading which causes these exceptions whenever multiple threads access the ACT tables. The DPS updates (which cause that call) run on a background thread which occasionally interferes with the UI thread updating the main table. OverlayPlugin just skips the update whenever this issue happens.It's a Debug message since it's not a critical issue. I just want to keep an eye on how often this happens. If it starts to happen frequently, I might have to figure out a solution and/or coordinate with Ravahn to fix this. All reactions

title: Add event for overlayplugin log message

chats.content: It'd be handy if everything showed up in the overlayplugin log could be subscribed to by an overlay, so it could (potentially) show that in game.This would help me do things like see errors when they happen on stream, or add console.log debugging that would show up in real time in an overlay vs in a window on another monitor.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

The next OverlayPlugin update already contains a mechanism which overlays can use to talk to each other. The broadcast handler raises a BroadcastMessage event each time it is called. You can pass a source and a message (msg). The source is intended to identify the source overlay to allow subscribers to filter out unknown messages.You could then replace the browser's native console.log function with one that forwards all log messages to the broadcast handler and subscribe to the BroadcastMessage event in the overlay that will display the log / error messages.I'd prefer this solution since OverlayPlugin's log can get fairly spammy in debug versions and it'd break the separation between overlays (overlays could see log messages from all enabled overlays). The broadcast method also works over WebSocket which OverlayPlugin itself couldn't support (since it obviously can't capture a remote browser's log).That said, I'm open to discuss this further. All reactions

title: Feature request: Map change event and target change events

chats.content: I would like to request a couple events:First one: Map change. Basically, same as ChangeZone, but for map changes instead of zone changes. This is currently accessible indirectly by subscribing to LogLines, but a plugin that subscribes in that manner won't have any idea what map you're in until another map change event comes in. In order to overcome this, it would need to return initial values upon subscribing like ChangeZone. Maps often make more sense than zones for things like triggers and timelines, since it lets you separate the triggers by individual boss fight for dungeons and such.Second: Something like EnmityTargetData and EnmityAggroList, that just informs you when any entity changes targets. Could be as simple as:{"type": "ChangeTarget","entity": 1234,"newTarget": 5678// or null, if it no longer has a target}Doesn't need the rest since that's all available in getCombatants.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

Just for the record: As long as the error only occurs occasionally, it's safe to ignore. Each time you see this error, memory reading failed for some reason (usually because the game was just launched or is closing). Enmity data is updated every 100ms by default so it's not an issue if one or two of those updates fail.I should probably add a filter which only logs an error if the error persists for a second or more. title: Discussion: Event cache "keys"

chats.content: Some things would be good candidates for caching due to their nature (they may have happened before a WS client connects), but the problem is that there would need to be multiple "keys".An example would be floor markers: I'd like to know where the markers are even if the client is started after the underlying log lines have been emitted, but there's eight of them. If you use the current cache implementation, you'd only get the most recently-placed marker.One workaround would be to track every marker on the OP side, and emit a single event that conveys all marker positions, but that's both more work on the OP side, and more work on the client side if you're only interested in initial positions + diffs thereafter.Other areas affected by this include:Player head markers (Line 29/NetworkTargetMarker, not the other kind)If I get around to the latter half of Feature request: Map change event and target change events #40 , it would be a similar story - I'd ideally want to know every target when initially connecting, but only diffs thereafterThe text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

I don't feel strongly about this, but my initial impression is that it'd be simpler to cache lines and emit them when initially connecting with WS.That way OP doesn't have to implement both lines and events,, and the handler on the client side can also only deal with lines.I think it's conceptually simpler, personally.If that means that we need a more complicated caching system to handle this so that multiple lines can be emitted, I think that's solveable, and would have to be done anyway in an event system. All reactions

The issue is that chromium uses OpenGL to render the HTML.Chromium is the rendering engine that Chrome uses.RainbowMage's OverlayPlugin uses Chromium Embedded Framework to render, so all Overlay Plugin's overlays are rendered with OpenGL.Now the issue with that is OBS does not support OpenGL windows.You can see the same thing if you try to capture, for example, a Minecraft window in OBS.OBS does support OpenGL for game capture mode and screen capture mode, but not window capture.So the only way you can get OBS stream with the overlay is to either use Screen Capture and get your whole screen, or (what I do) use a game capture to capture the game, then create a screen capture that is just the size of my overlay and then align the screen capture in OBS to match with the game capture.I'm not certain about @wingprinces's note about xtuaok's addon working, since xtuaok's addon uses RainbowMage's plugin, and by extension CEF, to render the window it should be subject to the same limitations. All reactions
@ezsoftware Thanks man. All reactions
@ezsoftware Do you know of the html file created when the ACT runs? The OBS CLR Browser Source Plugin might allow for this to work. All reactions

@Cleanse OverlayPlugin doesn't create an html file, it loads the html from the selected url/file into a CEF browser on a form and then passes JSON data with parsing information to an event hook in the javascript on the browser which then has to update the browser's DOM accordingly.However, ACT itself has the ability to run a webserver and display a simple parsing table which should be compatible with that plugin and will provide constantly updating parse results through a web page URL, though it won't be anything fancy like OverlayPlugin can generate.You can find the options for that under Options > Output Display > ACT Web Server. All reactions

Window style of the overlay windows are "tool window" which is not show in the Windows/Alt-Tab candidate. Some of the capturing software ignores tool window from window list.And, some of the window capturing software is not support layered window which overlay windows uses. Please use softwares which supports that to capture overlay windows.Alternative option I suggest is using ActServer plugin to show DPS on your broadcasting. All reactions

title: Suggestion: Only keep the most recent patch information in opcodes.jsonc

chats.content: I'd like to propose the idea of only keeping the most recent patch in the opcodes.jsonc file. Example:{// Region: Global// Version: 6.41"2023.06.14.0000.0000": {"MapEffect": {"opcode": 736,"size": 11},"CEDirector": {"opcode": 392,"size": 16},"RSVData": {"opcode": 142,"size": 1080}},// Region: CN// Version: 6.35"2023.06.28.0000.0000": {"MapEffect": {"opcode": 782,"size": 11},"CEDirector": {"opcode": 998,"size": 16},"RSVData": {"opcode": 783,"size": 1080}},// Region: KR// Version: 6.3"2023.06.02.0000.0000": {"MapEffect": {"opcode": 629,"size": 11},"CEDirector": {"opcode": 777,"size": 16},"RSVData": {"opcode": 115,"size": 1080}},}Why?GitHub itself will maintain history of past patches if it's necessary.It's not possible to run any game client versions other than latest with retail servers, and the state of things like Sapphire is quite far from stable/combat ready.Only maintaining one kv per region helps prevent merge conflicts.A merge conflict has happened before and will likely happen again with 6.45 retail and 6.31 KR happening at the same time.Merge conflicts will potentially cause delays for users given that a beta version of the parser plugin is likely to release quickly for opcode-only updates (most minor patches).Reduce filesize of the payload when fetching opcodes remotely (very minor, but figured I would mention it anyway).Basically, I'm not sure of the initial reasons for opting to maintain history when updating the opcodes.jsonc file, and I wonder if those reasons are still applicable today. As a side note, I'm also curious of the possibility of the versions being the same between two regions... maybe the answer would be to make the key the region rather than patch ver.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

The original intent of the file wasn't to keep every version of opcode, but rather to allow for quick lookup of version opcode info without having a conflicting key. Realistically, if JSON allowed for a compound key, the key would have just been region+version to begin with.Basically, there were two design requirements:The opcode definition must include the version, to prevent loading the wrong opcode for the current game versionAll lookups must be quick, as the lookup happens on packet received and must be resolved quickly to prevent locking threadsAs a side note, I'm also curious of the possibility of the versions being the same between two regions... maybe the answer would be to make the key the region rather than patch ver.Game versions are the build date of the executable, not the date that the patch drops. That makes it exceedingly unlikely that there is a version conflict.The reason that the region wasn't used as the key was to avoid the extra string compare while processing packet data All reactions

Game versions are the build date of the executable, not the date that the patch drops. That makes it exceedingly unlikely that there is a version conflict.I was aware that game versions were the build date; it didn't really change how I felt about it being "not impossible" - we've had situations where it was already pretty close, so I was just curious.The reason that the region wasn't used as the key was to avoid the extra string compare while processing packet dataMakes sense.The original intent of the file wasn't to keep every version of opcode, but rather to allow for quick lookup of version opcode info without having a conflicting key. Realistically, if JSON allowed for a compound key, the key would have just been region+version to begin with.Basically, there were two design requirements:The opcode definition must include the version, to prevent loading the wrong opcode for the current game versionAll lookups must be quick, as the lookup happens on packet received and must be resolved quickly to prevent locking threadsSo, if I'm understanding this correctly - the intent was never to keep "adding onto" the file, and we can remove the old versions? If so, I can make a quick PR to strip it, so that we can more likely avoid the merge conflicts 😅 All reactions

title: Delay and self-target issues with LineCombatant's PCTargetID/NPCTargetID

chats.content: I noticed a couple issues while testing these.For reference, the Target Overlay (which uses EnmityTargetData events) seems to work fine, so the logic in TargetMemory is good.But for the PCTargetID and NPCTargetID in LineCombatant, there seem to be two issues:There is a noticeable delay when de-selecting a target (PCTargetID => 0) despite the line normally being reasonably fast. Still a little bit slower than EnmityTargetData, but this specific case is very slow (~half a second).When targeting oneself, the value is 0 (i.e. no target). It seems to make no differentiation between targeting yourself and targeting nothing.I'd like to use these instead of subscribing to the very spammy EnmityTargetData event, especially since being part of the log file makes it reproducible, but these issues make it less usable compared to EnmityTargetData. To be clear - these don't seem to be issues with any OP logic - the game itself is doing this.I'm wondering what the best solution for this is. I can see:Change LineCombatant to read from TargetMemory for the local PC specifically.Create a new line or event that represents changes in target that uses TargetMemory (it could also support focus target).The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

Re: delay,The logic is defined in https://github.com/OverlayPlugin/OverlayPlugin/blob/main/OverlayPlugin.Core/MemoryProcessors/Combatant/LineCombatant.cs, but to summarize:Poll combatant data every 20msWhen in combat:If OwnerID, Type, MonsterType, Status, AggressionStatus, IsTargetable, Name, Radius, BNpcID, CurrentMP, or IsCasting1 have changed and the previous change for that field was more than 1000ms ago, write a line with all changed valuesIf BNpcNameID, TransformationId, WeaponId, TargetID, or ModelStatus have changed at all since the last poll, write a line with all changed valuesIf position data has changed and the previous change for that field was more than 250ms ago, and it has changed by more than 5 yalms, or angle data has changed by more than 45º, write a line with all changed valuesWhen out of combat:If OwnerID, Type, MonsterType, Status, AggressionStatus, IsTargetable, Name, Radius, BNpcID, CurrentMP, or IsCasting1 have changed and the previous change for that field was more than 5000ms ago, write a line with all changed valuesIf BNpcNameID, TransformationId, WeaponId, TargetID, or ModelStatus have changed and the previous change for that field was more than 1000ms ago, write a line with all changed valuesIf position data has changed and the previous change for that field was more than 1250ms ago, and it has changed by more than 15 yalms, write a line with all changed valuesWhen writing a line, if any position/heading data would be written, write all position/heading valuesTargetID is a calculated field so it's functionally checking PCTargetID for players and NPCTargetID for non-playersIs the delay when de-selecting a target exceeding the maximum possible time given the above criteria? e.g. in combat, is it exceeding 19ms (assuming worst possible timing), or out of combat is it exceeding 999ms (assuming worst possible timing)?Re: weird target values. I'm not sure what exactly would be going on here. I'll have to investigate.Re: target values in general. There are ActorControlTarget categories for SetTarget and SetPlayerTarget which could be emitted. But ActorControlTarget -> SetTarget is kind of spammy, compared to other AC categories.CountACTarget Category%23903SetPlayerTarget0.05%253883SetTarget0.63%40176153Total Packets Scanned100%And for comparison, across the same amount of log data, 3255585 261 lines were emitted.I'm not aware of a focus target AC category, I think that's client-side only? But I'd need to double check raw packet data to confirm. And also unfortunately I don't think the current player has any inbound network packets for changing targets at all. So going purely based off of network data is unlikely.Re: EnmityTargetData. In what way is this spammy? Is it emitting events when there haven't been any changes maybe? I haven't really looked too deeply into the enmity events. All reactions

Okay, it seems to be much more responsive in combat, but I don't know why it would behave this way when out of combat. Theoretically, the delay should be the same, whether you're initially selecting a target, selecting a different target, or deselecting a target, but it really feels like the latter is a bit slower. It's definitely still within the 1000ms worst case. If anything, selecting a target seems to be unexpectedly fast.I think, given that I'd still want it to work out of combat, it would be better to just make something new based off of EnmityTargetMemory.As for the current EnmityTargetMemory event:Yes, it will output even if nothing has changedIf I just want target data, it's very overkill. I'm already getting the target's other information from LineCombatant, and I may not even care about changes to enmity itself. If all I'm after is just the player's target (for example, to make a target overlay, or show who is currently targeted on a party overlay), all I really need is the ID like in LineCombatant.EnmityTargetData currently looks like this (heavily abridged):{"type":"EnmityTargetData","Target":{/* an entire combatant JSON for the dummy */},"Focus":null,"Hover":null,"TargetOfTarget":{/* an entire combatant JSON for myself */ },"Entries":[{"ID":12345,"OwnerID":0,"Name":"Name Here","Enmity":100,"isMe":true,"HateRate":100,"Job":24}]}Even if it did become its own event/line that emits only on a change, I'd be a little worried about the hover target, as that could easily be a spamfest on its own. All reactions

Looking at the logic currently in EnmityEventSource, it checks HasSubscriber so that it isn't doing pointless polling. Do you know what the performance impact of this polling is? I'm wondering if it makes sense to implement the new logic as an event rather than a line to minimize the performance hit, at the expense of having lower-quality data in the log.However, there's also the specific issue that EnmityEventSource also pulls the full combatants list in order to build the aggro list, which isn't strictly necessary if all you care about is a target ID and maybe focus target. All reactions

title: NativeMethods class does not unhook window events

chats.content: In the NativeMethods class constructor, events are hooked for when any window is brought to the foreground and when any window is minimized. These event hooks are never unregistered via UnhookWinEvent which can in some rare cases cause ACT to freeze when closing as these events get constantly invoked (not sure why, attaching a debugger just shows native code invoking the events on loop).The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

There's an issue that might occur if you've been using cactbot for a long time and did not perform some steps to remove and readd cactbot within OverlayPlugin from a cactbot update a while ago.Additionally, I think you'll have a much better time getting help synchronously (or at least faster) via the ACT Discord, specifically #plugin-discussion should have this subject pinned, and if that isn't able to get you up and running then #troubleshooting would be a decent place to try after that. title: Overlays No Longer Work On Multiple Desktops by Default

chats.content: Something seems to have been changed with this fork of the overlay plugin that makes overlays not obey the "Show windows from this app on all desktops" setting in Windows 10. This means that every time ACT is restarted the "Show this window on all desktops" settings must be set in order to use the overlay plugin on multiple virtual desktops at once.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions
Can you check if the 0.11.2 update fixes this?If it doesn't, did this work in previous releases from this fork? All reactions

In 0.11.2.0 overlays will now show on all desktops which completely solves my problem. It worked in 0.10.1.0 as well.However, If someone wanted it to show on only one desktop that is not an option as there is no way to change its behavior. It does not follow ACT's settings or display in task view so that one may limit it to only one virtual desktop.I did not realize that there was no way to stop the overlay from showing on all desktops before since that is what I always wanted it to do. All reactions

Since the original behavior was restored in 0.11.2, I'd say this bug has been resolved. The fact that it doesn't work with virtual desktops is a separate issue.If someone doesn't want to see the overlay on other virtual desktops, they can use the auto-hide functions to hide the overlays if the game isn't focused. If they want to see the overlay on that one virtual desktop even while the game isn't focused but not on other virtual desktops... then they're out of luck since that's not supported right now. All reactions

title: Add github workflow for automatic release building

chats.content: No description provided.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

One thing to note here is that the automatic updater is currently using .7z files, see: https://github.com/OverlayPlugin/OverlayPlugin/blob/main/OverlayPlugin.Updater/Updater.cs#L337I think the updater supports zip files too, so this is something to keep in mind.It'd probably be simpler if a release workflow only built one artifact. All reactions

Other considerations here is that it'd be nice to be able to kick off a release from a PR.cactbot handles releases by (me) doing: npm patch version && git push && git push --tags.Then the tag change kicks off the workflow: https://github.com/quisquous/cactbot/blob/main/.github/workflows/release.yml#L3-L6.OverlayPlugin isn't using npm, so can't use this approach anyway.However, you can't add a tag to a PR, and this would mean that only people who can push directly to the repository can do (or even propose) a release.I think it would be nicer if somehow changing the version in AssemblyInfo.cs kicked off a PR? But this version is in a whole bunch of places, and we'd need to make sure they agreed.I don't know.Just brainstorming here, but I think it'd be nice if somebody felt like we should have a release, they can just put up a PR, then it can just get merged, etc.Maybe I'm overthinking this. title: RegisterProcessChangedHandler has initialization races

There seems to be commented out code to handle this, I'm not sure why it's commented out.OverlayPlugin/OverlayPlugin.Core/Integration/FFXIVRepository.csLines 307 to 322ind239a89 // ProcessChangedDelegate(Process process)public void RegisterProcessChangedHandler(Action<Process> handler){var sub = GetSubscription();if (sub != null){sub.ProcessChanged += new ProcessChangedDelegate(handler);/*var repo = GetRepository();if (repo != null){var process = repo.GetCurrentFFXIVProcess();if (process != null) handler(process);}*/}}All reactions

I'm working on a pull request that fix this issue.This issue usually don't occur if plugin is already enabled, it only occurs if it loads before FFXIV_ACT_Plugin or gets enabled after ACT has started. 👍1 quisquous reacted with thumbs up emoji ❤️1 DieMoe233 reacted with heart emoji All reactions👍1 reaction❤️1 reaction

Update: I had came up with a solution that fixes this issue without overhauling how it works, but still has race condition in it just a lot less likely to happen.Gonna need bit more time on this.Specifically, if user enables a plugin and opens FFXIV at the same time, there is a race condition of setting the cached game process before registering handler gets called. To fix it I need to create events within repository to control order of execution with lock.Did repeated testing, actually the order of execution I was worrying about will never happen since C# events are implemented as collection of delegates, invoking event handlers will cause runtime loop through the collection and invoke event handler one by one.Because of the lock, when FFXIV_ACT_Plugin fires ProcessChanged event, it will get blocked when it sees the caching method; effectively making it wait for handler to subscribe then execute.Actually it does happen, it did not happen because when I'm paused on breakpoint, all other threads are paused, and events are not firing even though they are fired on another thread. When using Sleep(15000) in place of pausing on break point, race condition occurred as expected and game process is not detected. All reactions
Side note, most of the method in FFXIVRepository.cs should throw InvalidOperationException if FFXIV_ACT_Plugin is unavailable, instead of silently failing the operation. All reactions
PR #48 has been created for this issue. All reactions

title: Slightly unsafe log window update from another thread during startup

chats.content: WinForms is extremely picky about thread safety and UI controls and will throw exceptions when unnecessary.ACT by default has this checking turned off, but when I'm running my debugging builds, I leave it on to just keep me honest.I'm uncertain when this started, but the startup process of the plugin now does one such illegal cross-thread call:{...}[10/14/2023 10:02:17 PM] Info: AssemblyResolver: Loaded: Fleck, Version=1.2.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null[10/14/2023 10:02:17 PM] Info: InitPlugin: Initialised.[10/14/2023 10:02:22 PM] Error: InitPlugin: System.InvalidOperationException: Cross-thread operation not valid: Control 'logBox' accessed from a thread other than the thread it was created on. at System.Windows.Forms.Control.get_Handle() at System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase.get_TextLength() at RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.ControlPanel.AddLogEntry(LogEntry entry) at RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.Logger.Log(LogLevel level, String message) at RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.PluginMain.LoadAddons() at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Execute()--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown --- at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw() at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task) at RainbowMage.OverlayPlugin.PluginMain.<<InitPlugin>b__26_3>d.MoveNext()If it's complaining about just reading a property or something else minor, I'll just not even care... but in this case, it is trying to add text to the control from a Task(thread), which is actually unsafe and could potentially "crash" the control unexpectedly.Adding text(or any real update) should be wrapped with ActGlobals.oFormActMain.Invoke(), if not on the UI thread already(ActGlobals.oFormActMain.InvokeRequired).There are lots of ways the code could look.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

@valarninThe stacktrace is seemingly complaining about this line, which is untouched by your changes:https://github.com/valarnin/OverlayPlugin/blob/00d8b1221ed4b0e2ec7fbe6c54a7977ceb788a23/OverlayPlugin.Core/Controls/ControlPanel.cs#L115I'm less worried about there being a problem with reading the .TextLength property... but if that line evaluates to true, it will end up assigning to the .Text property which is actually a problem.I don't have plans to re-enable cross-thread checking in ACT... but if any random plugin decides to "do the right thing" and enable it...OverlayPlugin may no longer start. title: Using * or [::] as websocket bind address results in literal * in generated overlay URL

chats.content: If you use * as your WS server IP address (i.e. listen on all interfaces), then the generated overlay URLs will contain a literal *:The same thing happens with [::] which is the equivalent that will listen on ipv6 and ipv4.There isn't a single right answer for what should go there, but 127.0.0.1 (or ::1) or a very obvious placeholder value that the user needs to replace would both be an improvement.This works correctly when using 0.0.0.0 - it will change the URL to 127.0.0.1.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

title: WebWorker compatible common file(?)

chats.content: So this is out of left field,I spent the morning kind of messing around with setting up a new overlay and I was wondering if it would be possible to run the log parsing part in a web worker and then just post the interesting, processed, messages to my overlay to do stuff with.Unfortunately, common.js doesn't really work in a web-worker, for various reasons I imagine. For one, it poops whenever you try to use window which is not available in a worker, and for another I'm not sure if whatever magi-globals the plugin puts in the window exist in the worker space.Websockets work great, though, so I managed to get it working by modifying the contents of common. It's not ideal since it relies on implementation details that could change so I wonder if we could get like a common.worker.js in dist (or some other way cooler solution)?To get it to work I had to:Change wsUrl to not come from the location and instead be a param of connectWsMake an onmessage handler to initiate connectWs from the main process (the main process sends the wsUrl)Delete the 'else' part of the websocket/local statement so it always tries to use websocket.Change anything that assigned to window.variable into a const variable = declarationSorry if this is weird, it's not really an issue, it's a feature request so feel free to close it if it doesn't fit your scope! I would be willing to do a PR for the first version but I wanted to see if it's even interesting to you.Thanks for making this amazing bit of tech.The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

You're correct that window isn't available from the WebWorker's scope, however you can simulate the needed global-scope properties pretty easily for the purposes that common.js needs, something like this should be sufficient:window = window || {};You'd then make sure to run that before loading common.js or make it its own separate file that can be included/required depending on how you're doing things.As for the location property, that exists within the scope of a webworker already, it just uses the webworker's location to begin with, so if you append ?OVERLAY_WS=... to the webworker's location when creating it, that should be sufficient to pass it through. All reactions

title: Curl SSL Issues

chats.content: This is the conversation in discord that ends here: https://discord.com/channels/551474815727304704/551892582855344128/1049822282769510411 (with reply chains up)My conclusion from this is that we could try to fix curl to use the right system trust store, but it'd be better to switch to using System.Net.Http.HttpClient.GetStringAsync instead of using curl.(I don't know why this is using curl in the first place, vs just using built-in C# stuff.Maybe @valarnin remembers?)Does anybody see any potential issues to switching to using a different method for fetching files?The text was updated successfully, but these errors were encountered: All reactions

I think that using built-in .NET calls will break support for Win7 and earlier due to the raw.githubusercontent.com domain only supporting TLS 1.2 and TLS 1.3, but I don't have a win7 VM handy to test with.As Techno mentioned in Discord as well, this would also need to be checked against Linux. All reactions

ACT has some .NET config changes that are supposed to make even Vista work with TLS1.2 as long as .NET Framework 4.6(.1?) is installed.It's been a few years since I've tested this and my memory is now fuzzy. All reactions
This should be fixed by #186 All reactions

I don't know why this is using curl in the first place, vs just using built-in C# stuff.OverlayPlugin was my first real C# project, I've used curl a lot in the past and there were some weird errors related to downloads that I couldn't figure out. Switching to curl significantly reduced the user complaints about failed CefSharp downloads so I kept it.Curl should always use the right trust store since the libcurl.dll should be configured to use schannel (Windows' TLS implementation) just like the curl.exe shipped with Windows.That said, as mentioned above, this is obsolete now. All reactions
